tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: John begins to describe a vision of a mighty angel holding a scroll. In John's vision he is viewing what is happening from earth. This takes place between the blowing of the sixth and seventh trumpets.

tn.ref: He was robed in a cloud
tn.text: John speaks of the angel as if he were wearing a cloud as his clothing. This expression may be understood as metaphor. However, because very unusual things were often seen in visions, it might be understood as a literally true statement in its context. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: His face was like the sun
tn.text: "his face was bright like the sun" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: his feet were like pillars of fire
tn.text: The word "feet" refers to the legs. AT: "his legs were like pillars of fire" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: he put his right foot on the sea and his left foot on the land
tn.text: "he stood with his right foot on the sea and his left foot on the land"

tn.ref: Then he shouted
tn.text: "Then the angel shouted"

tn.ref: the seven thunders spoke out
tn.text: The thunder is described as if it were a person who could speak. AT: "the seven thunders made a loud noise" or "the thunder sounded very loudly seven times"

tn.ref: seven thunders
tn.text: Thunder occurring seven times is spoken of as if it were seven different "thunders."

tn.ref: but I heard a voice from heaven
tn.text: The word "voice" refers to the speaker. It is not the angel. AT: "but I heard someone speaking from heaven" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: raised his right hand to heaven
tn.text: He did this to show that he was swearing by God.  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])

tn.ref: He swore by the one who lives forever and ever
tn.text: "and asked that the one who lives forever and ever would confirm it"

tn.ref: the one who lives forever and ever
tn.text: Here "the one" refers to God.

tn.ref: There will be no more delay
tn.text: "There will be no more waiting" or "God will not delay."

tn.ref: the mystery of God will be accomplished
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will accomplish his mystery" or "God will complete his secret plan" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Connecting Statement:
tn.text: John hears the voice from heaven, which he had heard in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:10:03|10:4]], speak to him again.

tn.ref: The voice I heard from heaven
tn.text: The word "voice" refers to the speaker.  AT: "The one I heard speak from heaven" or "The one who had spoken to me from heaven" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: I
tn.text: The word "I" here refers to John.

tn.ref: He said to me
tn.text: "The angel said to me"

tn.ref: bitter
tn.text: "sour" or "acid." This refers to a bad taste from the stomach after eating something that is not good.

tn.ref: it will be as sweet as honey
tn.text: "It will taste as sweet as honey" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: languages
tn.text: This refers to the people who speak the languages. AT: "many language communities" or "many groups of people who speak their language" or "speakers of many languages" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
